lines_and_colors: Blazing in gold, and quenching in purple,
Leaping like leopards in the sky,
Then at the feet of the old horizon
Laying her spotted face to die;
Stooping as low as the oriel window,
Touching the rood, and tinting the barn,
Kissing her bonnet to the meadow
And the Juggler of Day is gone!
document.title: Blazing in gold and quenching in purple
document.publication: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Variorum Edition, Franklin, 1998
